Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There were some good fight moves in the film - you have to remember that it is not an action movie, but rather payed homage to classic martial arts movies along with a twist (I think) of two old ladies cut up quite a bit.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may disagree with me on this title, saying that the story is way to hateful to be liked and that the characters are too rude, but if you think about it, we have those characters in our mind looking like them with their flaws and all. Grudgingly even being attracted by them

If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John ‘Lucky’ Buck. Some minor movie star credibility is obtained at the end by the stunt double for actor Andy Devine.
